q: Which is the longest mountain range in the world?
desc: The Andes in South America are the longest continental mountain range, stretching 7200 km.

q: Which mountain range is located in South Central Asia?
desc: The Himalayas, Karakoram, and Hindu Kush ranges span South Central Asia and are known for their high peaks.

q: Where is the Great Dividing Range located?
desc: The Great Dividing Range is a major mountain range in East Australia, extending 3600 km.

q: Which mountain range lies in North-West Africa?
desc: The Atlas Mountains stretch across North-West Africa and have a length of about 1930 km.

q: Which mountain range is found in Western India?
desc: The Western Ghats run along the western coast of India and span about 1610 km.

q: Which mountain range is located in the USA?
desc: The Alaska mountain range is located in the USA and is about 1130 km long.

q: Which is the highest mountain peak in the world?
desc: Mount Everest, located on the Nepal-Tibet border, is the highest peak in the world.

q: Where is K2 (Godwin Austin) located?
desc: K2, also known as Godwin Austin, is located in the Pakistan-occupied region of India.

desc: Mount Kilimanjaro is the highest mountain in Africa and is located in Tanzania.

q: Where is the mountain peak Cotopaxi located?
desc: Cotopaxi is a famous volcanic mountain peak located in Ecuador.

desc: The Alps, located in Europe, are the shortest among the listed ranges at 1050 km.

desc: Mount Kilimanjaro is located in Africa, specifically in Tanzania.

desc: Mt Everest is situated on the border between Nepal and Tibet (China).

q: Where is the Tibetan Plateau located?
desc: The Tibetan Plateau lies between the Himalayas and Kunlun Mountains, making it the highest and largest plateau.

q: Which plateau is located in Southern India?
desc: The Deccan Plateau covers most of Southern India and is known for its rich volcanic soil.

q: Where is the Arabian Plateau situated?
desc: The Arabian Plateau is a vast plateau in South-West Asia covering most of the Arabian Peninsula.

q: Which plateau is located in Central-Eastern South America?
desc: The Plateau of Brazil covers a large part of central-eastern South America, especially Brazil.

q: Which country is home to the Plateau of Mexico?
desc: The Plateau of Mexico is a highland region located in central Mexico.

q: The Plateau of Columbia is located in which country?
desc: The Plateau of Columbia lies in the northwestern United States, including parts of Washington and Oregon.

q: Where is the Plateau of Madagascar found?
desc: The Plateau of Madagascar is located on the island nation of Madagascar off the southeast coast of Africa.

q: Which plateau lies in North-West North America?
desc: The Plateau of Alaska is in the northwestern part of North America, mainly in the state of Alaska.

q: The Plateau of Bolivia is associated with which mountain range?
desc: The Plateau of Bolivia, also known as the Altiplano, lies between the Andes Mountains.

q: Which plateau lies south of the Columbia Plateau in the USA?
desc: The Great Basin Plateau lies just south of the Columbia Plateau in the western United States.

q: Where is the Colorado Plateau located?
pool: South of Great Basin Plateau, USA
answer: South of Great Basin Plateau, USA
desc: The Colorado Plateau lies in the southwestern United States, just south of the Great Basin Plateau.

q: Which plateau is known as the 'Roof of the World'?
desc: Due to its high elevation and size, the Tibetan Plateau is often called the 'Roof of the World'.

desc: The Plateau of Brazil covers a large portion of the central and eastern areas of Brazil in South America.

q: Which plateau lies in an island nation in the Indian Ocean?
desc: The Plateau of Madagascar lies in the island nation of Madagascar, located in the Indian Ocean.

q: Which of these is not located in the USA?
desc: The Deccan Plateau is located in southern India, not the United States.

q: Which local wind is known as the 'Snow Eater'?
desc: Chinook is a hot, dry wind in the Rockies and is also known as the 'Snow Eater'.

q: Fohn is a hot, dry wind found in which mountain range?
desc: Fohn is a local wind that blows in the Alps.

q: Which local wind blows in Egypt?
desc: Khamsin is a hot, dry wind that blows in Egypt.

q: Which wind is also known as 'Blood Rain'?
desc: Sirocco is a hot, moist wind from the Sahara to the Mediterranean and is also called Blood Rain.

q: The Solano wind blows towards which region?
desc: Solano is a hot, moist wind that moves from the Sahara towards the Iberian Peninsula.

q: Which wind is also called the 'Guinea Doctor'?
desc: Harmattan is a dry, dusty wind from Western Africa and is known as the 'Guinea Doctor'.

q: Bora wind blows from Hungary to which country?
desc: Bora is a cold, dry wind blowing from Hungary to the North of Italy near the Adriatic Sea.

q: Mistral is a cold wind that blows from where?
desc: Mistral is a very cold wind that blows from the Alps over France.

q: Which wind blows down the western side of the Andes?
desc: Punas is a cold, dry wind blowing down the western side of the Andes Mountains.

q: Which wind occurs in the tundra region?
desc: Blizzard is a very cold wind found in the tundra region.

q: Purga is a cold wind found in which region?
desc: Purga is a cold local wind in the Russian tundra.

q: Levanter is a cold wind that occurs in which country?
desc: Levanter is a cold wind that blows in Spain.

q: In which country is the Norwester wind found?
desc: Norwester is a hot wind found in New Zealand.

q: Santa Ana is a hot wind in which part of the USA?
desc: Santa Ana is a hot, dry wind found in South California in the USA.

q: Which local wind originates in the Sahara and moves toward the Mediterranean Sea?
desc: Sirocco is a hot, moist wind from the Sahara towards the Mediterranean.

q: Which local wind is cold and blows near the Adriatic Sea?
desc: Bora is a cold, dry wind blowing from Hungary to Northern Italy near the Adriatic Sea.

q: Which local wind blows from the interior of Western Africa?
desc: Harmattan is a hot, dry wind blowing outwards from the interior of Western Africa.

q: Which local wind is commonly experienced in the Alps region?
desc: Fohn is a hot, dry wind experienced in the Alps.

q: What is the nature of the Blizzard wind?
desc: Blizzard refers to very cold winds in the tundra region.

q: Which wind affects the region of South California?
desc: Santa Ana is a hot wind experienced in South California, USA.
